title: Senior Financial Analyst at FPC National (Chicago, IL)
text:
Title: Senior Financial Analyst 
SUMMARY DESCRIPTION: The Senior Financial Analyst is responsible for generating global sales forecasts, tracking and reporting sales, profitability performance and facilitating pricing analysis for the company's global sales and marketing teams. The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Finance Director and the Director of Marketing and the position will have strong cross-functionality and exposure to senior leadership. Responsibilities of the Senior Financial Analyst: • Consolidation and analysis of global financial statements, including actual results, monthly forcecasts, and the annual business plan. • Utilize systems to provide monthly sales and profit margin results on timely basis. • Analyze performance vs. budget to enable business resources to target areas for profitability growth. • Work with Oracle Demantra and Cognos systems to ensure data integrity, simplification of forecast process, and quality of management reporting. • Set standards for Microsoft Dynamics CRM opportunity tracking and reporting. • Provide ad hoc analysis to improve business decision making. • Evaluate account-level pricing requests and review product line and part level pricing assumptions for ongoing quoting. • Assess part level sales and profit margin contribution for capacity expansion and value creation projects. • Model new product P&Ls, coordinating and analyzing engineering, manufacturing and marketing assumptions. • Drive continuous improvement and standardization in sales, marketing, and engineering financial reporting areas. Preferred Knowledge and Experience of the Senior Financial Analyst • Bachelor's degree in Accounting/Finance/Business Administration • 2-5+ years of experience in finance/accounting/manufacturing • Ability to build and model financial data in Microsoft Excel with high proficiency • Successful candidates must be able to effectively manage up, down, and across all levels of the organization • Experience in an international/global environment preferred • Strong time management and project management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize assignments in a fast-paced, agile environment
